Key Match Events: A foul initially whistled against Green with 1:40 remaining before halftime was challenged by the Warriors and the call was overturned.
The Warriors won another challenge midway through the fourth.
Post-Match Reflections: Warriors coach and players were not mentioned in post-match reflections, but Grizzlies coach Taylor Jenkins mentioned that Ja Morant has begun doing some on-court shooting work and will undergo imaging on his injured hip and pelvis area early next week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: G Lindy Waters III made his second start of the season, then fell to the floor after blocking a shot with 1:58 left in the second quarter. Waters didn't return because of a hyperextended left knee.
Curry, who had scored 36 and 37 points the past two games, respectively, shot 4 for 9 with three 3-pointers.
Others: The Golden State Warriors beat the Memphis Grizzlies 123-118 on Friday night in a physical NBA Cup game.
Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 32 points for Memphis in a matchup of teams with deep rotations who rely heavily on their reserves.
